entry.et: Middle English preferraunce, from Middle French preferance, from Medieval Latin praeferentia, from Latin praeferent-, praeferens, present participle of praeferre

def.dt: :the act of preferring :the state of being preferred
:the act, fact, or principle of giving advantages to some over others
:priority in the right to demand and receive satisfaction of an obligation
:preferential treatment given qualified veterans of the United States armed forces under federal or state law
:special consideration (as by allowance of points) on a civil service examination
